column4: I installed updates last night but it fails when trying to configure the kernel (intrepid), can anyone please take a look and help?? http://paste.ubuntu.com/111158/
thanks, I will try that as soon as the new updates finish
where are the packages? /var/cache? something like that?
if you installed through apt-get, using auto-complete (tab) with "sudo apt-get remove nvidia" should list all the packages you might need to uninstall
try just typing in a console, anywhere sudo dpkg --configure -a
yea.. its a no go, also tried, "sudo dpkg --configure --pending" "sudo apt-get -f install"
_2: http://paste.ubuntu.com/111559/ (the dpkg --configure didnt work again, so i went with foxwoods)
I knew it... sorry for neglecting that info
unfortunately.....you'll probably have to roll your own kernel....if _2 can't help
